main event: An unidentified flying object was observed at 0257 hours Z, 16 May 1958 near Fort Bragg, North Carolina.
interesting points: The object appeared to be slightly larger than the planet Mars and was red-orange in color.
The object moved at a terrific speed, following a steady 360-degree path.
The object faded from sight as it became obscured by cloud cover.
The sighting lasted for approximately 2-5 minutes.
The observer was a doctor of psychology with the American Embassy in The Hague, Netherlands.
sighted object: a round object, slightly larger than the planet Mars, that was red-orange in color
witnesses: a doctor of psychology with the American Embassy in The Hague, Netherlands
